page.title: 03 "KEDLESTON HALL"
page.content: Kedleston Hall was originally the home of the Curzon Family, though little of the 850 years of that family now remains. The House is today, as always,a famiy home.The Scarsdale barony was confered in 1761,{the {present owner is Francis,3rd Viscount {Scarsdale,and 30th Lord of Kedleston. The Estate, of 5,000 acres contains the house,garden,grazing land,parkland ,brook,3 wiers,lake,a golf course and church.The estate buildings and the Hall are the work of the{architect, {Robert Adam.}He designed the 3 arched bridge over the Cutler Brook,the boathouse, summer house, orangery,as well as many features in the house itself. The lake,man made,is the home of swans,many species of ducks and Canadan geese.Sheep (including Jacobs) graze on the rough pasture.
